meanings.sent1: The apple was unred, it was green instead.
meanings.sent2: She chose an unred dress for the party.
meanings.sent3: The unred sky at sunset looked beautiful.
meanings.sent4: The unred leaves danced in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The unred stop sign confused the drivers.

meanings.definition: To remove the color red from something.
meanings.sent1: He unred the painting by painting over the red parts.
meanings.sent2: She unred the photo to make it black and white.
meanings.sent3: The artist unred the canvas, leaving only shades of gray.
meanings.sent4: The sunset unred the sky, turning it orange.
meanings.sent5: The rain unred the bright red umbrella.

meanings.sent1: The unred manuscript was full of errors.
meanings.sent2: She submitted the unred report without proofreading.
meanings.sent3: The unred essay made the teacher cringe.
meanings.sent4: The unred speech was a disaster, full of mistakes.
meanings.sent5: The unred document had typos everywhere.
